item.title: Keeping a Mid-2011 MacBook Air Running With Linux
item.description: I have a 2011 vintage MacBook Air that has not seen much usage. I purchased it from a previous employer’s auction of used computers. It did just enough things - browsing, watching videos, working on documents, and writing some code in a pinch. Somewhere along the way, the battery stopped holding a charge and the MacBook became tethered to a power cable. This led me to replacing the battery, following tools, replacement battery and excellent instructions from iFixit1.
